metadata.title: CVE-2020-35521 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libtiff. Due to a memory allocation failure intif_read.c, a crafted TIFF file can lead to an abort, resulting in denialof service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.3.0-6
libtiff-tools - 4.3.0-6
libtiff5 - 4.3.0-6
libtiffxx5 - 4.3.0-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-6').
